The oslo module called utils is no more.

This had been cleaned up in openstack/common, but left in the config
file. Clean that up too.

Change-Id: I15b96c53aff3281a44250e9beb4ec56fb80bf9b6

commit_message:
Split quantum into server/agent elements.

Compute nodes will need the agent, but do not want the whole
quantum-server running.

Change-Id: I6b899d816956a4c953d747d070b27e9599a86081

I think I get it (but it would be good to get the author to confirm).

The logic is that if the action is allowed from a number of vm_states, then the action itself shouldn't force the vm_state to active.

So for example at the moment a reboot on a stopped instance would go:

vm_state  task_state
Stopped   None
Active    Rebooting
Active    None

whereas with this patch it would go:
vm_state  task_state
Stopped   None
Stopped   Rebooting
Active    None"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-04-27 00:13:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Doh, messed up the format there:

At the moment rebooting a stopped instance would go:
 vm_state task_state 
 Stopped  None 
 Active   Rebooting 
 Active  None

whereas with this patch it would go: 
 vm_state  task_state 
 Stopped   None 
 Stopped   Rebooting 
 Active    None'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-04 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
The vm_state should not be modified until the task is complete.

Several methods in nova.compute.api alter the vm_state value before
proceeding with the actual work. The initial vm_state may be changed to
something other than the initial vm_state (which is a problem: since we
do not know what the initial state actually was, we cannot reasonably
recover and set the corresponding ERROR if a problem with the operation
occurs).

Actually done:

Removed vm_state update before executing task

Changed methods:
- reboot
- pause
- unpause
- suspend
- resume
- rescue
- unrescue

Fixes: bug #1158509
Change-Id: I5ee7aebf3c4831dd577ed5ab9aa155095152f8a8

fix compute units in measurement doc

related to bug#1165123 and patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26462)

commit_message:
Implement check_active for quantum net, port, router

These quantum resources go through a BUILD status before becoming
ACTIVE (or DOWN).

This could explain the issues seen in
Bug: #1176661

Change-Id: I659774cd402b71be102376b31e2d78bf225d37a6

subject: Removing redundant, possibly flaky test
messages:
[{'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-05-16 15:51:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can we change it to a without wait variant ?'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-05-16 16:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think the only 100% safe way to test actions in transient states such as BUILD in tempest is via whitebox tests (i.e. forcing the state into the DB). 
As the test actually affects the nova API service only, this is something that could probably be tested as part of nova tests rather than tempest.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-05-16 16:07:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

[{'created': '2013-05-16 15:38:56.000000000', 'message': 'Removing redundant, possibly flaky test

test_create_image_when_server_is_building may fail is
the VM goes to ACTIVE too fast.
The test is already covered by the images whitebox tests.

Fixes bug #1180868

Change-Id: Ied4cc5f80456c617bb45f62ef91b7d31b938b654
'}]
commit_message:
Removing redundant, possibly flaky test

test_create_image_when_server_is_building may fail is
the VM goes to ACTIVE too fast.
The test is already covered by the images whitebox tests.

Fixes bug #1180868

Change-Id: Ied4cc5f80456c617bb45f62ef91b7d31b938b654

commit_message:
Moved part of test cases to another class

Some of the test cases were modifying the shared container and then cleaning up
in a 'finally' block, causing a lot of extra code. I put them into a separate
class that creates a new container after each test case run and removed the
manual cleanup code.

Change-Id: I8ad3768bef584fc29e2abeed9d21988cf710107a

[{'created': '2013-05-09 23:11:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add serialization hooks to RpcDispatcher

This adds hooks for deserializing arguments before calling a
dispatched method, and for serializing the result before it is
passed back over RPC to the caller. The base serialization calls
a to_primitive() method on the result, if it exists. The
deserialization is just a pass-through hook right now, which can
be implemented appropriately in a subclass.

Change-Id: I845727552097893d74f2ee7f5bb63b15460acdf7
'}, {'created': '2013-05-11 00:17:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add serialization hooks to RpcDispatcher

This adds hooks for deserializing arguments before calling a
dispatched method, and for serializing the result before it is
passed back over RPC to the caller. The base serialization calls
a to_primitive() method on the result, if it exists. The
deserialization is just a pass-through hook right now, which can

commit_message:
Add serialization hooks to RpcDispatcher

This adds hooks for deserializing arguments before calling a
dispatched method, and for serializing the result before it is
passed back over RPC to the caller. The base serialization calls
a to_primitive() method on the result, if it exists. The
deserialization is just a pass-through hook right now, which can
be implemented appropriately in a subclass.

Related to blueprint rpc-object-serialization

Change-Id: I845727552097893d74f2ee7f5bb63b15460acdf7

commit_message:
Add requirements.txt support to os-svc-install.

http://pad.lv/1179008 has all of OpenStack migrating tools/pip-requires
to requirements.txt. We will use both during the transition.

Fixes bug #1179008

Change-Id: I7b3c64902b4c1b6f83402a21248a4eadad725c34

commit_message:
Make quantum-server post-start sleep 10 seconds.

A better long term solution is something that polls trying to reach
quantum-server on the port it is configured to listen on. However,
extending the usual sleep to 10 seconds has at least a moderate chance
of avoiding the race between 'start quantum-server' and the listen()
call that makes it reachable.

Change-Id: I56453e3e9d718216e3cfee0a3bc353c51f74b3be

[{'created': '2013-05-19 17:58:26.000000000', 'message': "Add post-start option to os-svc-daemon.

We also migrate os-svc-daemon to supporting switches to modify its
behavior and be more flexible as it grows. The old positional style is
still supported but will be deprecated.

Each service will have a unique way to verify that it has started. The
default 'exec sleep 1' will be sufficient for some, but not all. Quantum
is the first example, which can take more than 5 seconds to open a
listening socket.

Due to a lack of knowledge and testing on systemd, it will simply print
out a warning about the issue until we have a better answer.

Change-Id: I8d0e0842dfa66b2e32b942270ed071e593d3865e

Change-Id: I8d0e0842dfa66b2e32b942270ed071e593d3865e

commit_message:
Add post-start option to os-svc-daemon.

We also migrate os-svc-daemon to supporting switches to modify its
behavior and be more flexible as it grows. The old positional style is
still supported but will be deprecated.

Each service will have a unique way to verify that it has started. The
default 'exec sleep 1' will be sufficient for some, but not all. Quantum
is the first example, which can take more than 5 seconds to open a
listening socket.

Due to a lack of knowledge and testing on systemd, it will simply print
out a warning about the issue until we have a better answer.

Change-Id: I8d0e0842dfa66b2e32b942270ed071e593d3865e

commit_message:
Work around boto dependency in heat-cfntools.

Heat-cfntools has a hard dependency on boto == 2.5.2. However, this
version of boto breaks newer versions of cloud-init when used with
OpenStack and specifically with Heat generated userdata. That problem is
documented here: http://pad.lv/1177576

The change to allow >= 2.5.2 has been submitted to be fixed upstream
and can be tracked in this bug: http://pad.lv/1180582 .

Change-Id: I1ce96901754472e6b0d518d26431d3b3a26daea6

commit_message:
Make identity providers use uri_join_paths

Instead of defining the same _path function in each of these providers,
I have moved it to uri_join_paths in openstack-common. This change
simply makes use of that new function.

All tests pass.

Change-Id: Ie821d4210f1a34f6aa9f259d8b591f95c6304485

[{'created': '2013-05-18 16:33:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add a uri_join_paths helper function and tests

The standard URI::join method is not intended for joining URI relative
path segments. This function merely helps to accurately join supplied
paths. While the objective should be to use the OpenStack python
clients for much of the URL wrangling, there may still be times when
joining paths may be necessary.

All tests passing.

Change-Id: I39fe37b2b15ed05701d928065e6d70109634a382
'}]
commit_message:
Add a uri_join_paths helper function and tests

The standard URI::join method is not intended for joining URI relative
path segments. This function merely helps to accurately join supplied
paths. While the objective should be to use the OpenStack python
clients for much of the URL wrangling, there may still be times when
joining paths may be necessary.

All tests passing.

Change-Id: I39fe37b2b15ed05701d928065e6d70109634a382

LGTM, only a +1 because waiting for some db experts to review'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-05-14 06:53:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Could you give normal names for variables not rows1 rows2 table1 table2 it is really hard to review it.. (we are not robots..)

+ could you use sqlalchemy.utils.get_table instead of work with metdata. 

+ why you are testing only tables with uuid column? I don't see any reason..

And one more nit that is not about this patch. What do you think about making your tests more sqlalchemy independent?

Other tests from test_db_api are generic so it will be nice to add required methods in db_api and sqlalchemy implementation to make these tests also sqlalchemy independent. It is really importnat because in feature we will have one more backend https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/db-mysqldb-impl ."}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-05-14 14:13:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-05-14 14:20:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Boris:

variable names: done, but some of our table names are long so some of the variable names still have to be abbreviated to have any hope of < 80 columns

get_table: done

uuid: for easy teardown.  For non-uuid tables we can't delete from every table with this id (because they're not unique) but must instead keep a mapping of table to ids inserted.  Which is doable but makes the test slower.  Also, some tables have foreign key constraints and the tests won't work there without specific knowledge of the constraints, or fancy code that knows how to read the constraints and walk all the tables in constraint order, which seems like overkill.

sqlalchemy independence: I guess we have to get there eventually but we can't gate all other DB work on it or we'll never get anything done."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-14 15:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Improve unit tests for DB archiving.

Test all tables that have a uuid column and no constraints that make
generic testing difficult, rather than just a couple of tables.

Make the teardown code more generic.

Add test_archive_deleted_rows_2_tables, which tests that we can
archive rows from two tables in one call.

Change-Id: If08aac3c6869820c72dfcb1bf6d22d19c2995c8a

subject: Attributes for the Image service are in the ['openstack']['image'] namespace.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-16 23:34:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/29454/1/check/gate-cookbook-openstack-image-chef-lint/5 : SUCCESS in 3m 21s
- http://logs.openstack.org/29454/1/check/gate-cookbook-openstack-image-chef-unit/5 : SUCCESS in 3m 39s
'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-05-17 17:05:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Matt, I thought the pattern was default['openstack-image']?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-05-17 17:07:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oh, I see now Matt...

So I think we're going to want to  get these related renaming attribute patches in after Ionut's series of SUSE-related patches are in. The reason is because it will be much less prone to merge conflicts...

You cool with waiting a day or so on this?"}, {'account_id': 216, 'date': '2013-05-17 17:07:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I don't see much point in nesting to '["openstack"]["image"]'.  IMO the cookbook is openstack-image.  I like the attributes matching the cookbook name.  Compute, Glance, Identity, already follow this pattern.'}, {'account_id': 216, 'date': '2013-05-17 17:08:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I prefer to not nest attributes. :/"}, {'account_id': 26, 'date': '2013-05-17 18:19:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This was discussed on the ML previously, but the benefit is that we're able to see all the 'openstack' attributes in a single pass (ie. knife node show FOO -a openstack). The attributes still match the cookbook, they're just in the openstack namespace already (ie. [openstack][image] and [openstack][identity]).

I'm fine with waiting on Ionut's merges, but I think this is worthwhile."}, {'account_id': 1032, 'date': '2013-05-19 03:37:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 216, 'date': '2013-05-19 04:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve; Approved

Okay, thx for helping me understand the benefits of nesting the attributes.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-19 04:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-19 04:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Fails

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 26, 'date': '2013-05-19 16:23:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Re-based and resubmitted as https://review.openstack.org/#/c/29714/'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-15 19:46:38.000000000', 'message': 'Disable selinux for RHEL6 only if enabled.

 * Attempting to disable selinux when it is not enabled
   results in a non-zero exit status which halts devstack.
 * Addresses bug 1175444

Change-Id: I7f6492dea7c52d153e755cda826d6fabd53f3771
'}, {'created': '2013-05-16 00:44:18.000000000', 'message': 'Disable selinux for RHEL6 only if enabled.

 * Attempting to disable selinux when it is not enabled
   results in a non-zero exit status which halts devstack.
 * Addresses bug 1175444

Change-Id: I7f6492dea7c52d153e755cda826d6fabd53f3771
'}, {'created': '2013-05-16 00:57:57.000000000', 'message': 'Do not run selinux commands if it is disabled.

 * Execution of the setenforce command when selinux was not enabled
   was resulting in a non-zero exit status, which halted devstack.
 * Addresses bug 1175444

Change-Id: I7f6492dea7c52d153e755cda826d6fabd53f3771
'}]
commit_message:
Do not run selinux commands if it is disabled.

 * Execution of the setenforce command when selinux was not enabled
   was resulting in a non-zero exit status, which halted devstack.
 * Addresses bug 1175444

Change-Id: I7f6492dea7c52d153e755cda826d6fabd53f3771

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-19 06:32:51.000000000', 'message': 'Smoke attribute implies gate attribute

The smoke attribute now implies that the gate attribute
be applied as well. This should simplify the attribute
marking and reduce the probability of tests accidentally
not being included in the gate.

Partially implements blueprint set-gate-attribute

Change-Id: Ic273b216d8702c670bfbff60616bf4d07185c3c8
'}]
commit_message:
Smoke attribute implies gate attribute

The smoke attribute now implies that the gate attribute
be applied as well. This should simplify the attribute
marking and reduce the probability of tests accidentally
not being included in the gate.

Partially implements blueprint set-gate-attribute

Change-Id: Ic273b216d8702c670bfbff60616bf4d07185c3c8

[{'created': '2013-04-17 14:17:59.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize instance queries in compute manager

Some instance queries against the db through the conductor can be
optimized to return a reduced set of instances as needed for the job
at hand. Most of these are part of periodic tasks, so the win is
kind of big.

Compute methods where queries can be made more efficient:

_get_instances_on_driver
_poll_rebooting_instances
_poll_rescued_instances
_reclaim_queued_deletes
_run_image_cache_manager_pass

Resolves bug 1169970.

Change-Id: I7c2fab48944e34765b3fff8ce10bc64a5cd826c8

commit_message:
Optimize instance queries in compute manager

Some instance queries against the db through the conductor can be
optimized to return a reduced set of instances as needed for the job
at hand. Most of these are part of periodic tasks, so the win is
kind of big.

Compute methods where queries can be made more efficient:

_get_instances_on_driver
_poll_rebooting_instances
_poll_rescued_instances
_reclaim_queued_deletes
_run_image_cache_manager_pass

Resolves bug 1169970.

Change-Id: I7c2fab48944e34765b3fff8ce10bc64a5cd826c8

commit_message:
Allow admin to delete default security groups

Previously there was no way to delete a default security groups which
isn't ideal if you want to clean up after deleting a tenant. This patch
allows default security groups to be deleted by the admin.

Fixes bug 1175393

Change-Id: I2214c7dabf0f2ec960ce10ebbbcdc513bc73664c

commit_message:
The utils module in oslo is no more.

The utils module in oslo has been removed (with most of its
functionality moving across to strutils). Luckily it was imported
in heat but never actually used, so removing it is relatively easy.

Change-Id: I3df27a553ebe7de188893038f9285d4b9a789d19

commit_message:
Strip exec_dirs prefix from rootwrap filters

Make the rootwrap filters more portable by removing
the explicit exec_dirs prefix from them. This allows
a binary to be installed in any of the exec_dirs and
still be used by rootwrap, which improves cross-distro
portability.

Change-Id: Ieccb8c480e0e116a976d0920ab900305a5615015

'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-05-16 00:14:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Does this work when running the whole suite?  What are the time differences?

I thought this was necessary when running the tests against a sqlite in memory DB, but maybe not with the way that we are generating the schema now; we are not using the migrations.'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-05-16 02:19:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

ayoung -

I ran the timings, a couple of times with and without.

Here it is with this change:
Ran 1309 tests in 516.610s
Ran 1309 tests in 514.971s

Here it is without this change:
Ran 1309 tests in 478.267s
Ran 1309 tests in 473.980s

It's slower with the change.

The tests have code to set the global engine to None but that never really did anything because the old engine was cached."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-05-16 16:14:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-05-16 17:51:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

you should absolutely be able to cache the engine and sessionmaker ... i totally don't understand the goal behind this change?"}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-05-18 19:02:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

I'm going to try approach c (from the bug report)."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-15 23:10:26.000000000', 'message': "Don't cache the engine in common.sql.core.Base

Using the cached engine leads to incorrect results when the
cached engine is wiped out.

Sql Tests were changed with commit
efc30beab10faf4720a96322adb135726662b025 to clear out the global
engine on every test, which invalidates the engine cached in the
backend. This caused tests to fail when run in pairs.

Change-Id: I3fb7bdbe384c5de80e7da28be17b83aaee99a758
Fixes: bug #1179259
"}]
commit_message:
Don't cache the engine in common.sql.core.Base

Using the cached engine leads to incorrect results when the
cached engine is wiped out.

Sql Tests were changed with commit
efc30beab10faf4720a96322adb135726662b025 to clear out the global
engine on every test, which invalidates the engine cached in the
backend. This caused tests to fail when run in pairs.

Change-Id: I3fb7bdbe384c5de80e7da28be17b83aaee99a758
Fixes: bug #1179259

I'd like to avoid to review overhead of such inconsequential changes. Often changes like these can be batched across the whole code base to avoid churn"}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-05-15 11:24:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

or turn on the right pep rule to catch this one, and fix across the project. We're currently excluding all the 12* rules, when 125, and 123 are really crazy. The rest would make the code better."}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-05-15 14:17:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

@p-draigbrady	I've seen other reviews where people complain if you batch whitespace changes *with* other code.  So, there are opinions on both sides of that fence.

Personally, I don't care, Chris's change couldn't be simpler, so we might as well just approve it."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-05-15 14:51:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

line 1098 also has pep8 indent issues.

I don't like one off fixes for pep8 things where the pep8 rules are ignored, because it means it will slip back in later somewhere with a refactor.

Running pep8 fixes through isn't fun, but it is useful early in the cycle instead of dealing with bunch of one offs that slip away over time."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-15 17:26:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Alright, I can't friggen win.  I put these in with another review and I get dinged for them being unrelated changes.  I rip them out into a separate review... and now in order to fix these things that I spot... I must go through a lot more code to find more of these...just to clean these stupid things up?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-15 17:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-15 17:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Ready For Review'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-05-15 18:45:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I tend to agree with Sean,  I would prefer not to fix these if we aren't planning in gating on them down the road.  That being said, IMHO thats not enough to warrant a -1."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-15 21:46:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'll go fix up more of them if that helps.  Or I'll just leave this review around as WIP and use it as I find more until there's a number more of them.  The ones in particular I'm trying to fix just really annoyed me as I was looking through code. :)"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-05-15 21:46:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-05-16 12:03:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree, that's why I had/have a 0 review. I'm sort of -0 on the change. Not something I would -1."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-05-16 12:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

The change is fine, though _much_ better if it cleaned up all the other instances of this. I was just trying to avoid the precedent of having to run such changes through the whole commit/check process.'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2013-05-16 12:58:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

For changes as small as this I prefer to let it in to avoid extra overhead on both the author and the reviewers. :)'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-05-16 14:35:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

given that chris got yelled at for including the whitespace fix inside his functional review, I'll let this one through. I understand the frustration.

commit_message:
Adding new test for iSCSI live block migration

Requrires a new config value as the test depends on a
specific patch being made to XAPI to support the
relax-xsm-sr-check behaviour

Change-Id: I81cc39fed392fce9dfbda5683ffba29eeba936be

commit_message:
RemoteFsDriver: copy_image_to_volume and copy_volume_to_image

This functionality was recently added to the NFS driver --
it should instead be added to the RemoteFsDriver class to cover
both NFS and GlusterFS drivers.

Change-Id: I10136f8d1628128a93c4adfe2cb9447b99720558

commit_message:
Deprecate "extension:xxx" policies but preserve bw compatibility

Blueprint make-authz-orthogonal

Patch #4 for this blueprint.
With this change, if policies starting with 'extension' are still
present in policy.json, a deprecation warning will be emitted, and
the policy will be translated in the corresponding, new-style,
policy(ies).

Change-Id: Iccf0f36cc2547c35c66854b8a3fdb7185b5214bd

commit_message:
More changes to rename this to openstack-compute

In the previous commit, the vast majority of the work to move this
repo to openstack-compute was completed. Functionally it works. This
change is intended to address some cosmetic issues and make it
consistent with work done in other cookbook repos.

All tests pass.

Change-Id: I58216cd87b9ff0a77c599c7b5aab132ab2a9304d

[{'created': '2013-05-16 20:54:03.000000000', 'message': "Don't raise unnecessary stack traces in EC2 API

exception.EC2APIError exceptions are always expected, so no reason to have a
LOG.exception when one is raised.  Furthermore nova.api.ec2.ec2_error already
logs the exception so the duplicate log statement is just removed

Fix Bug 1180973

Change-Id: I4b42a9a764f6e15bb94a383e8a725d52d7436bd7
"}]
commit_message:
Don't raise unnecessary stack traces in EC2 API

exception.EC2APIError exceptions are always expected, so no reason to have a
LOG.exception when one is raised.  Furthermore nova.api.ec2.ec2_error already
logs the exception so the duplicate log statement is just removed

Fix Bug 1180973

Change-Id: I4b42a9a764f6e15bb94a383e8a725d52d7436bd7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-18 09:22:06.000000000', 'message': 'Log a warning if dnsmasq version is below the minimum required

It has been noted that older versions of dnsmasq may have unexpected
behavior, so this patch introduces a check on dnsmasq version; if
the minimum version is not met, a warning is logged. This is less
invasive than raising an Exception and abort the dhcp agent, even
though this also seems like a perfectly acceptable behavior.

Fixes bug 1170793

Change-Id: Idd91c3753fb05f223ed0e3c53ad692ee65ea4905
(cherry picked from commit 364032897293256436647cb89c61a3dffb408946)
'}]
commit_message:
Log a warning if dnsmasq version is below the minimum required

It has been noted that older versions of dnsmasq may have unexpected
behavior, so this patch introduces a check on dnsmasq version; if
the minimum version is not met, a warning is logged. This is less
invasive than raising an Exception and abort the dhcp agent, even
though this also seems like a perfectly acceptable behavior.

Fixes bug 1170793

Change-Id: Idd91c3753fb05f223ed0e3c53ad692ee65ea4905
(cherry picked from commit 364032897293256436647cb89c61a3dffb408946)

Remove unnecessary parens in test_volumes

Return statements were using unnecessary parens, this removes them.

Change-Id: Iee63ffa826d323a89493e16c1b9592bae74e350f

commit_message:
Use strict=True instead of `is_valid_boolstr`

Oslo's `bool_from_string` learned the `strict` keyword which allows
callers to detect invalid boolean values, so we can use that instead
of having a new Nova-specific function.

Change-Id: I61bfa4029897c7304bd54d6cdae9f9a9bc4c1f78

commit_message:
Fix swift-ring-builder for swift 1.8

In some case, there are no spaces before - of the balance in swift 1.8.
The change fix this.

/etc/swift/object.builder, build version 9
32768 partitions, 3.000000 replicas, 1 regions, 3 zones, 9 devices, 200.00 balance
The minimum number of hours before a partition can be reassigned is 24
Devices:    id  region  zone      ip address  port      name weight partitions balance meta
             0     1     1      10.68.0.45  6000       sdd 100.00      32768 200.00
             1     1     2      10.68.0.46  6000       sdd 100.00          0-100.00
...

Change-Id: Ic7757a22ce94e4d51ae11780d4626c90a9ed430f

Code looks good; works on my SAIO. Any chance of using mock.patch() in the test instead of rolling your own?"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-09 21:08:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Alright, here's a weird case I found.

1) Enable allow_referrer_on_write in the proxy server config; restart Swift.

2) Set a container to have .r:* in its write ACL (swift post foocon -w '.r:*')

3) Upload a file anonymously with curl (curl -v -X PUT --data-binary @CHANGELOG http://192.168.22.2:8080/v1/AUTH_test/foocon/CHANGELOG)

So far, so good. But wait, there's more!

4) Turn off allow_referrer_on_write in the proxy server config; restart Swift.

5) Upload a file anonymously with curl -- THIS WORKS.

Basically, I don't think step 5 should work any more since the setting is now turned off in the config file. Am I completely off-base here?"}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-05-09 23:15:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

More robustness around toggling the config value needs to be added'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-05-10 16:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-07 22:09:41.000000000', 'message': 'added support for referrer ACLs on writes

Passing allow_referrer_on_write=True to clean_acls()
will prevent the exception from being raised. This allows
auth systems to add the ability to support publicly writeable
containers by setting "X-Container-Write: .r:*".

Change-Id: I08f53698a01a7f17e273bf77b30f824d12103a17
'}, {'created': '2013-05-09 03:16:51.000000000', 'message': 'added support for referrer ACLs on writes

commit_message:
added support for referrer ACLs on writes

Passing allow_referrer_on_write=True to clean_acls()
will prevent the exception from being raised. This allows
auth systems to add the ability to support publicly writeable
containers by setting "X-Container-Write: .r:*".

Change-Id: I08f53698a01a7f17e273bf77b30f824d12103a17

socket.gethostname() will return hostname or fqdn, this would possibly

Fixes bug #1175483

Change-Id: If99e52bd2a812547ef79d1acc8157e7aece30ceb
"}]
commit_message:
use getfqdn() to replace gethostname() for param host

socket.gethostname() will return hostname or fqdn, this would possibly
lead nova-network doesn't work.

Fixes bug #1175483

Change-Id: If99e52bd2a812547ef79d1acc8157e7aece30ceb

commit_message:
Allow mysql.create-users to specify password.

Until we have a good way of generating passwords and feeding them
back to other services (bug #118436), we will have to push them in
to mysql via Metadata.

Change-Id: Idfa64bf93b6f018ae08a5c43ba3c73f428c477d6

commit_message:
Remove nova-rpc-zmq-receiver.

This program has some problems and it is not anywhere within our desired
configuration for TripleO. It can be added later if a user decides to
make use of ZeroMQ.

Change-Id: I9ddcad2ddc4223c054e9332f7b142e8748179e4d

A couple of comments:

1) Could you please (if you didn't) use git mv instead of delete and add ? (I know sometimes Gerrit behaves weird with this but I just want to make sure you renamed the file instead of deleting / adding it)

2) It's not obvious to me why this patch depends on the other one. If it doesn't, please, remove the dependency.

commit_message:
rbd: convert old-style functional tests to store tests

These test the store api directly, and are more up to date
than the old functional tests that went through the api.
The store tests already including testing get_size()
and getting the image size by looking at the return value
of get().

Change-Id: I58674f2d3612cf35e0b7fe0e319ad5ffec4af9c9
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

[{'created': '2013-05-17 20:10:15.000000000', 'message': "Update/Publish volume service updates on delete.

The Filter scheduler weighing function was failing because
we were only updating the capacity info either on the periodic
60 second interval or after succesful creates.

The result was that if you exceeded your capacity within the
update interval you would no longer be able to create volumes even
if you deleted existing volumes until the update was performed and
published.

Since we're updating on on create, there's no reason why we shouldn't
do the same on delete for the applicable volume-service.

alone, but with this change we keep things up to date so the filter scheduler
has the correct picture of the world.

commit_message:
Update/Publish volume service updates on delete.

The Filter scheduler weighing function was failing because
we were only updating the capacity info either on the periodic
60 second interval or after succesful creates.

The result was that if you exceeded your capacity within the
update interval you would no longer be able to create volumes even
if you deleted existing volumes until the update was performed and
published.

Since we're updating on on create, there's no reason why we shouldn't
do the same on delete for the applicable volume-service.

The periodic updates are still important for other purposes so they're left
alone, but with this change we keep things up to date so the filter scheduler
has the correct picture of the world.

Fixes bug: 1180976

Change-Id: Ic551f512c5a0cf51bafa8b60f0b6b7debbe22692

[{'created': '2013-05-17 22:59:23.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure cfn-* scripts are installed to /usr/local/bin

Fedora python prefix is /usr, not /usr/local. Also Fedora python
is not set up at all to handle modules installed to /usr/local.

Installing only the scripts to /usr/local/bin works fine on Fedora.

When heat-cfntools is install with pip again, use the following:
pip install heat-cfntools --install-option="--install-scripts=/usr/local/bin"

commit_message:
Ensure cfn-* scripts are installed to /usr/local/bin.

Fedora python prefix is /usr, not /usr/local. Also Fedora python
is not set up at all to handle modules installed to /usr/local.

Installing only the scripts to /usr/local/bin works fine on Fedora.

When heat-cfntools is installed with pip again, use the following:
pip install heat-cfntools --install-option="--install-scripts=/usr/local/bin"

Change-Id: Id11e923c25bd3161c91b2e5166f6ac3bf04c30a0

commit_message:
Run nova-bm-dnsmasq in foreground.

Upstart either wants to track forks, or have processes in the foreground
so it can just track them as children.

Change-Id: I43409c20136a98e1b3d36c4d63e5b31ebdcf326c

commit_message:
Remove novnc package from nova-compute.

We only need the static files from upstream novnc, so we will install
them from git.

Not installing novnc also means directories like /var/lib/nova and files
like /etc/nova/policy.json from nova-common are no longer created and
thus must be manually created.

Also we were never running nova-novncproxy, so add that to the
nova-compute element.

Fixes bug #1180239

Change-Id: I24ddc4c7e649c07dd7e197e6ac1d1bc79d42fdef

commit_message:
Run fixfiles restore in chroot instead of firstboot.

Boot time was 30 seconds shorter in an all-in-one devstack
environment.

Thanks to Ghe Rivero for a pointer to the solution
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=208275

Change-Id: I90d0c96d5659326ba67d6119b96d9a4113adf7fe

commit_message:
Force text mode console in base element.

Apply kernel command line parameters to force Linux to remain in text
mode. Typical distro kernels quickly switch into a graphical screenmode
and this is incompatible with common Lights Out Management hardware
which is able to intercept text mode consoles to display them remotely.

Change-Id: Id553972c4fd87e78c9e6fe344331a399913d965e

commit_message:
Capitalize boolean values in config files

This patch allows the usage of Puppet boolean values and still
configure values with OpenStack boolean style: True/False.

Change-Id: I6e66b9b64cd63dee4f73e4f6b6121a62573c8cfe

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-08 18:38:12.000000000', 'message': 'Remove install_venv_common.py dependency on oslo.

* tools/install_venv_common.py: Remove dependency on oslo.cfg and
replace it with optparse. This script is to be run without external
dependencies as it is bootstrapping the process of installing external
dependencies. As a result it should not depend on oslo.cfg.

* tools/install_venv.py: Update assignment of return value from
parse_args to handle a tuple.

Change-Id: Ifb67bbfeec4eabc943c2a88a34fe535c57f174a1
'}, {'created': '2013-05-10 22:17:50.000000000', 'message': 'Perform oslo-incubator code sync.

run_tests.sh cannot install a virtualenv with tools/install_venv.py as
tools/install_venv_common.py depends on oslo.config which is an external
dependency. The virtualenv installer should not depend on any external
dependencies. Fix this by performing a code sync with oslo-incubator.

Note this adds a new dependency on six and changes the way versioning is
determined.

Change-Id: Ifb67bbfeec4eabc943c2a88a34fe535c57f174a1
'}, {'created': '2013-05-10 22:39:20.000000000', 'message': 'Perform oslo-incubator code sync.

run_tests.sh cannot install a virtualenv with tools/install_venv.py as
tools/install_venv_common.py depends on oslo.config which is an external
dependency. The virtualenv installer should not depend on any external
dependencies. Fix this by performing a code sync with oslo-incubator.

Note this adds a new dependency on six and changes the way versioning is
determined.

Change-Id: Ifb67bbfeec4eabc943c2a88a34fe535c57f174a1
'}]
commit_message:
Perform oslo-incubator code sync.

run_tests.sh cannot install a virtualenv with tools/install_venv.py as
tools/install_venv_common.py depends on oslo.config which is an external
dependency. The virtualenv installer should not depend on any external
dependencies. Fix this by performing a code sync with oslo-incubator.

Note this adds a new dependency on six and changes the way versioning is
determined.

Change-Id: Ifb67bbfeec4eabc943c2a88a34fe535c57f174a1

commit_message:
Remove usage of locals() for formatting from nova.api.*

Using of locals() for formatting string is a nasty thing because:
1) It is not so clear as using explicit dicts
2) It could produce hidden errors during refactoring
3) Changing name of variable causes change in message
4) Creating a lot of unused variables

fixes bug 1171936
Change-Id: I293d7ebb875f65cce322d4938d1ae323f3aded8d

flakes is a simple wrapper of pep8 and pyflakes. It doesn't call pylint. pylint does more advanced checkings than pyflakes with type inference, etc. E.g. functional signature errors are reported in pylint but not pyflakes. In my opinion it's not appropriate to replace it with flake8."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-04-21 13:20:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Can we get lintstack into the hacking repository some how? It would be a lot nicer to be able to pip install our checkers instead of the copy/paste divergence we're seeing between projects."}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2013-04-21 13:43:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sean: that's a good idea. But at the moment, only Nova has lintstack. So there is no copy/paste problem (yet!). We can revisit pylint/lintstack soon when other projects have it. I guess I'm suggesting to keep the pylint related stuff and convert pyflakes, hacking etc to pbr+flake8 so that the static checking remains functionally the same.

P.S. Around Folsom timeframe I tried pylint on Quantum, and it had some weird problems. Probably things have changed now. I'd be interested to revisit. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-04-25 14:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yup. totally agree. Let me re-do this patch.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-04-25 14:42:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Also - we could add lintstack to the hacking repo as an installed program - since we'll be installing hacking anyway. commit_message:
Switch to flake8+hacking.

Remove a bunch of local custom scripts. Replace with configurable
external tools.
Use local hacking checks for nova specifics.

Change-Id: I75a01375ba0ec36d2ff05abc47abe0a3f225eda5

returned.

commit_message:
Added Conflict Exception to the exception code map

The Conflict Exception is added for HTTP error code 409.
However this exception is never raised as this class is not added to
the error_code map and always raises the ClientException whenever a
409 code is returned.

Fixes bug #1168826

Change-Id: I7045eae33533ff603f4aab61ea988264b46f0d09

commit_message:
Restore compatibility with PrettyTable < 0.7.2

PrettyTable 0.7.2 defaults to print a table even if
the resultset is empty. Restore previous behavior
to be in line with older prettytable releases.

Change-Id: Idd1d0c2c2f41966076517cbc8819ba9a5e097306

commit_message:
Clean up a pyflakes error in a comment.

This is a little-bit silly, but it's the last thing. pyflakes parses
python lines that are in docstring comments that are prefaced by >>>.
So, without the import, pyflakes complains about undefined import.

Change-Id: Ibac77367efb07b65b992694b2de19473ec9ef473

commit_message:
Align usage of test skipping.

There were three different mechanisms for skipping tests in the suite.
For the most part, skipIf was used, so sync to that. Additionally, it
was being used as a decorater in most places, but as a call in a few,
so make it a decorator everywhere. Finally, if it's on the setUp method,
it's not necessary for it to be on any of the individual tests in the class.

Change-Id: I7fbd09a6bc015e698a190b989d0f8641c4adb63e

commit_message:
Use apt-get dist-upgrade during image build.

* devstack-vm-update-image.py: Previously apt-get upgrade was used but
this does not update all desired packages like the kernel. Perform a
dist-upgrade instead to get everythin.

Change-Id: I948e2a89d4c5655e7e52a46b5734825508028cfc

commit_message:
Add test for glanceclient shells

Add unittests for the following modules:
* glanceclient.shell
* glanceclient.v1.shell
* glanceclient.v1.legacy_shell
* glanceclient.v2.shell
Also add mock library to the tools/test-requires

Implements: blueprint glanceclient-shells-unittests
Change-Id: I5ec527c5efff3726932d234d7c67e08149643f89

commit_message:
Restore default interval

As we switched to multi-publisher pipelining, we modified,
I believe by mistake, the default polling interval from 600
to 60 second.

Change-Id: I4192a52aab1cbb744cd7ddf212e5ed3b0a3a27e6
Fixes: bug #1181153

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-28 17:26:24.000000000', 'message': 'Accept env variables to override default passwords

Preserves the default passwords corresponding to the OpenStack Install and Deploy Manual while allowing environment variables to specify user provided passwords. As well, a single common password for all the service users can be specified using the SERVICE_PASSWORD environment variable.
This fix restores compatibility with the version of this script released in Folsom where the environment variables could override default passwords. It also preserves compatibility with the fix for bug 1073291 that brought the script into line with the docs (but unfortunately broke backwards compatibility).
There is no warning emited if the user does not override the default passwords as was present in Folsom, but not in Grizzly. This makes the fix output compatible with Grizzly only. Note that the logic for warnings pre-Grizzly was unclear. The script is clearly mared "sample" and warnings are present in the comments.

Change-Id: I927fcddf04dcb87e5c9252f0874939b17f3c4809
Fixes: bug #1166182
'}, {'created': '2013-05-15 15:25:51.000000000', 'message': 'Accept env variables to override default passwords

commit_message:
Accept env variables to override default passwords

Preserves the default passwords corresponding to the OpenStack Install
and Deploy Manual while allowing environment variables to specify user
provided passwords. As well, a single common password for all the service
users can be specified using the SERVICE_PASSWORD environment variable.

This fix restores compatibility with the version of this script released
in Folsom where the environment variables could override default passwords.
It also preserves compatibility with the fix for bug 1073291 that brought
the script into line with the docs (but unfortunately broke backwards
compatibility).

There is no warning emited if the user does not override the default
passwords as was present in Folsom, but not in Grizzly. This makes the
fix output compatible with Grizzly only. Note that the logic for warnings
pre-Grizzly was unclear. The script is, however, clearly named "sample"
and warnings are present in the comments.

Change-Id: I927fcddf04dcb87e5c9252f0874939b17f3c4809
Fixes: bug #1166182

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-16 17:21:34.000000000', 'message': 'Build VM images when min_ready >= 0.

* devstack-vm-update-image.py: Previously we would not build new VM
images when the base_image.min_ready value was <= 0. Change this check
to only skip image updates when the min_ready value is < 0. This allows
us to have up to date images even when we do not actually want to have
any slave VMs running on that provider. You can still prevent image
building by setting min_ready to -1.

Change-Id: If63c2cffeca13f0f7281fe83432926d48323aa69
'}]
commit_message:
Build VM images when min_ready >= 0.

* devstack-vm-update-image.py: Previously we would not build new VM
images when the base_image.min_ready value was <= 0. Change this check
to only skip image updates when the min_ready value is < 0. This allows
us to have up to date images even when we do not actually want to have
any slave VMs running on that provider. You can still prevent image
building by setting min_ready to -1.

Change-Id: If63c2cffeca13f0f7281fe83432926d48323aa69

commit_message:
Cast `size` to int before comparison

`_get_and_check_image_metadata` pulls `size` from the image, which
comes in as string, but fails to convert it to an integer before
comparing with the flavor's `root_gb` size. This patch adds the cast
along with some test coverage for this method.

Fixes bug 1180159

Change-Id: I92bc9d6a808e49173d806e434cb145c751c8314a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-07 02:54:26.000000000', 'message': 'extracting credentials

Moves the credentials API into its own backend.

LDAP was not going to be able to support credentials.

Even with a custom schema, many people are using LDAP in read only
mode, which means that they would not be able to use the  credentials
API at all.  By splitting it out, we have a workable solution for
both SQL and LDAP Identity backends.

Change-Id: I10ad4b36c6f03d1712621eaffcfefa48a5453aff
'}, {'created': '2013-05-07 03:12:28.000000000', 'message': 'extracting credentials

Change-Id: I10ad4b36c6f03d1712621eaffcfefa48a5453aff
'}, {'created': '2013-05-08 21:39:16.000000000', 'message': 'extracting credentials

Moves the credentials API into its own backend.

LDAP was not going to be able to support credentials.

Even with a custom schema, many people are using LDAP in read only
mode, which means that they would not be able to use the  credentials
API at all.  By splitting it out, we have a workable solution for
both SQL and LDAP Identity backends.

Drops the Foreign Key constraints off the Credentials table, as there
is now no guaranttee that users are stored in the same backend.

commit_message:
extracting credentials

Moves the credentials API into its own backend.

LDAP was not going to be able to support credentials.

Even with a custom schema, many people are using LDAP in read only
mode, which means that they would not be able to use the  credentials
API at all.  By splitting it out, we have a workable solution for
both SQL and LDAP Identity backends.

Drops the Foreign Key constraints off the Credentials table, as there
is now no guaranttee that users are stored in the same backend.

Blueprint extract-credentials-id

Change-Id: I10ad4b36c6f03d1712621eaffcfefa48a5453aff

In my point of view, the solution you proposed breaks API consistency by allowing clients to use any json type in place of the expected boolean one.'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2013-04-24 20:29:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

some cleanup and questions"}, {'account_id': 7309, 'date': '2013-04-25 14:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The target of my patch is to enforce a correct API request by returning an appropriate error if the enabled field is of any type other than boolean.

Regarding your comments, it seems that my current patch is not appropriate.
I see another way to implement it by checking the attribute type earlier in the workflow:
I can remove all current patch code and make the check in "identity.controllers.py" with 

    # CRUD extension
    def create_user(self, context, user):
        [...]
        if 'enabled' in user and not isinstance(user['enabled'], bool):
            msg = 'Enabled field should be a boolean'
            raise exception.ValidationError(message=msg)
        [...]

Thus, it will only check the type coming from API requests and not from internal function calls.

Do you approve this approach ?

If yes, can you please point me where the tests should be located: I see a module "test_v3_identity" testing API calls but where is the v2 tested ?'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-04-25 16:37:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

V2 Tests are not explictly labeled that way, but most likely you want tests/test_content_types.py:CoreApiTests'}, {'account_id': 494, 'date': '2013-04-26 19:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Bruno: again, at the very least I would expect you to try to caste the value to a boolean using bool() before tossing an error.

I am fine having the stuff in the backend layer _and_ the api layer (data integrity is lovely and not everything goes through the controller), I just think we should probably at least convert 0|1 into True|False'}, {'account_id': 7309, 'date': '2013-04-29 13:35:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-04-29 14:07:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-19 14:54:29.000000000', 'message': 'Http 400 when user enabled is not a boolean

When creating or updating a user, no type check was performed on the
enabled attribute. Therefore, if enabled value is not a boolean but
a string or an int, keystone responds with an incorrect Http 500
error code and the stacktrace.

The change introduces a type validation of the enabled attribute
before trying to push it into the database. If the type is not a
boolean, then keystone now returns an appropriate Http 400 error
code with a message pointing a bad format for the attribute.

A test case has been added for the case when enabled attribute is
a string or int.
Others test cases with missing enabled attribute have been updated
to explicitely set this attribute.

The same correction can be done for create/update projects.

commit_message:
Http 400 when user enabled is not a boolean

When creating or updating a user, no type check was performed on the
enabled attribute. Therefore, if enabled value in JSON/XML is not a
boolean buta string or an int, keystone responds with an incorrect
Http 500 error code and the stacktrace.

The change introduces a type validation of the enabled attribute
at backend and api layer. If the type is not a boolean, keystone
now returns an appropriate Http 400 error code with a message
pointing a bad format for the attribute.

Test cases have been added to file test_backend and
test_content_types for testing the case when enabled attribute is a
string or int when creating or updating user.

The same correction can be done for create/update projects, domains.

Change-Id: I7d2fe3acf0c4dbd3ce5bdf9f4d059df085853b84
Fixes: bug #1110435

commit_message:
Initialise resources when service is created.

Without this, calls to validate_template will fail until the first
parser.Stack is created.

resources.initialise() is called in EngineService __init__
to avoid this happening in another service method in the future
Fixes: bug #1181045

Change-Id: I68a74ec7993aff4b74d449a3ae33315b93e9cb0d

commit_message:
break out whitebox tests

move whitebox tests to their own directory, with rules around
them. We had only a small number of tests here, and we don't
currently run these in gate, so these aren't added to tox.ini yet.

Part of bp:tempest-repo-restructure

Change-Id: Ic1d2158cd92d13ae25f026289f680396aa0ec3a8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-13 19:32:21.000000000', 'message': "move boto tests to thirdparty directory - part 1

this is part one of the boto refactor, there are still some
shared base classes (and the ec2 & s3 clients are added to every
test case still), however this gets the front end of the boto
runs moved to the thirdparty directory.

3rdparty in the proposal had to become thirdparty in implementation
as python doesn't like modules that start with numbers. Oh well.

We continue to run these tests as part of normal runs by adding
them to the tox.ini file.

Part of bp:tempest-repo-restructure

Change-Id: I30df582a3183453f6c7b36b1ea6857195e953950

commit_message:
move boto tests to thirdparty directory - part 1

this is part one of the boto refactor, there are still some
shared base classes (and the ec2 & s3 clients are added to every
test case still), however this gets the front end of the boto
runs moved to the thirdparty directory.

3rdparty in the proposal had to become thirdparty in implementation
as python doesn't like modules that start with numbers. Oh well.

We continue to run these tests as part of normal runs by adding
them to the tox.ini file.

Part of bp:tempest-repo-restructure

Change-Id: I30df582a3183453f6c7b36b1ea6857195e953950

commit_message:
add scenario directory

this adds the scenario directory as part of the tempest
restructure, and moves scenario tests over to the new directory.

To ensure we got everything that used the old DefaultClient and
DefaultManager classes these are refactored out into the scenario
directory as OfficialClient and OfficialClientManager.

The Nework Smoke test base class becomes NetworkScenarioTest, and
the two test files that used that come over to scenario directory
in the process.

These are all done with a single tempest/scenario/manager.py file
for now. As the scenario tests grow we'll figure out better
refactorings there.

This gives us 4 scenario test files as a starting point for future
scenario work.

Fixed remaining refactor issues with network tests

Clean up the documentation on the extracted classes

Part of bp:tempest-repo-restructure

Change-Id: I143b282c58cfac3bf979ba5ac68226155beff343

NETWORK_MODE switch added.

Additional parameter was introduced to allow quick switch between two possible networking modes.

Change-Id: I9ef2b8b3feed6e647bd384727dc0f1a16b2000e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-17 10:37:54.000000000', 'message': "set CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL in devstack to address volume races

After reordering some tests in tempest we exposed a new race. By
default cinder reports free / used space on the cinder periodic
interval (default 60 seconds). In a constrained environment where
we are building and destroy volumes quickly (with secure delete
off) we will get fails out of cinder where it can't build a
volume because it thinks it's out of space (it's not).

The current work around is to decrease the periodic task interval,
the cinder team is working on getting this content updated more
regularly so we wouldn't need this work around in the future.

This race is currently blocking the merge of the tempest.

Needed for bp:tempest-repo-restructure

Change-Id: Ibf49ff6467c871e84fcb716b4762b679b2fb405f
"}]
commit_message:
set CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL in devstack to address volume races

After reordering some tests in tempest we exposed a new race. By
default cinder reports free / used space on the cinder periodic
interval (default 60 seconds). In a constrained environment where
we are building and destroy volumes quickly (with secure delete
off) we will get fails out of cinder where it can't build a
volume because it thinks it's out of space (it's not).

The current work around is to decrease the periodic task interval,
the cinder team is working on getting this content updated more
regularly so we wouldn't need this work around in the future.

This race is currently blocking the merge of the tempest.

Needed for bp:tempest-repo-restructure

Change-Id: Ibf49ff6467c871e84fcb716b4762b679b2fb405f

[{'created': '2013-05-16 11:02:50.000000000', 'message': "Remove some redundant code for bool opt actions

You can see how this code came about here:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14125/20..21/openstack/common/cfg.py

but the only time BoolOpt:_get_argparse_kwargs() gets passed the action
kwarg is from _add_inverse_to_argparse() where we pass 'store_false'.

Change-Id: Ic6aa123680b5eb9aa220152389f3535b703fdf7b
"}]
commit_message:
Remove some redundant code for bool opt actions

You can see how this code came about here:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14125/20..21/openstack/common/cfg.py

but the only time BoolOpt:_get_argparse_kwargs() gets passed the action
kwarg is from _add_inverse_to_argparse() where we pass 'store_false'.

Change-Id: Ic6aa123680b5eb9aa220152389f3535b703fdf7b

commit_message:
Break out common functionality for filters and weights

In the context of openstack.common.scheduler:

base_filter.BaseFilterManager and base_weight.BaseWeightManager had
duplicated code.

This patch breaks that code out into a shared base class:
base_handler.BaseHandler

Change-Id: Ie5232c6dd9876a75170beda71adde90fc6bb4153

commit_message:
Extract matchmaker_ring to own module

The base matchmaker module should not have
all the matchmakers implemented within. Instead,
we desire to break them out.

For purposes of deprecation, logs a warning when
importing from the ZeroMQ driver.

Change-Id: I76936edd97309621a9c28363dccd792293a1c0d3

commit_message:
Check QCOW2 image size during root disk creation

glance can only tell us the size of the file, not the virtual
size of the QCOW2. As such we need to check the virtual size of
the image once its cached and ensure it's <= to the flavor's
root disk size.

Change-Id: I833467284126557eb598b8350a84e10c06292fa9
Fixes: bug 1177830
(cherry picked from commit 44a8aba1d5da87d54db48079103fdef946666d80)

'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-05-17 09:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-17 09:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-17 09:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Hi,
At the moment we are trying to get the dnsmasq version updated. It is something that will take some time. I have validated the fixes and they work when running 2.48. I hope that this can be a temporary solution until we have updated the dnsmasq version in RHEL. 
I think that the fact that we have the warning message should enable the user to have the ability to update if necessary.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-05-17 09:00:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi,
I think that we can bump the minimum version to what you suggest. Armando's log warning and documentation patch ensure that the user is able to understand that they are not using the officially supported version.
At the moment devstack should run on RHEL 6.4 and CentOS. People trying to use Quantum will run into problems, namely VM's will not get IP addresses.
I am not sure when RHEL will increase the dnsmasq version but at least this is a fall back so that they can evaluate and play around with Quantum. Does 'Do so at your own risk' suffice?
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-05-17 09:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-05-17 09:00:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This is counter to what I planning to propose: bumping the version up.  For good IPv6 support we need version >2.60 (it supports DHCPv6 and better RA).  I concerned supporting 2.48 prevents us from moving forward.  There's also bugs fixes in 2.49 and 2.56 (double-free) that can be trigger by normal Quantum operation.

Version 2.48 was released in 2009.  Are there alternatives for deploying OpenStack without falling back to a 4 year old release of dnsmasq?"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-05-17 09:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-05-17 09:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-17 09:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Add support for dnsmasq version 2.48

Following the bug fix for bug 1170793 we are able to add
in support for dnsmasq versions that do not support tags.

2.48 is the version shipped in RHEL 6.4

Change-Id: Ia7d2b1c0adb477159ce146bcd4323d4b2795bff5

commit_message:
fix reference to tenant id.

Administrator can create resource, even if the tenant of resource is
different from the one of authentication. For example, administrator
can operate 'quantum net-create' command with different tenant
between the authentication tenant(--os-tenant-name) and --tenant-id.

In this case, quota cannot be restricted with the resource tenant,
because it is restricted with --os-tenant-name.

This patch fixes this problem.

Fixes: bug #1179729

Change-Id: I8ce893bb583d52f81c661082372d725bebf9c1be

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-09 04:15:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix response when credential and project id don't match

This fix the erroneous behavior when the project id in the url and the project
id gathered from the given credentials return BadRequest and an error message
pointint out to a wrong url.

From now on this scenario will return Unauthorized (401), since you're possibly
trying to access something that your id doesn't allow, and a message saying:
"Project id from given credentials and url don't match".

Change-Id: Ib066394e5d2f5062b6160344d8c7764cffd7d16d
Fixes: bug #915151
'}]
commit_message:
Fix response when credential and project id don't match

This fix the erroneous behavior when the project id in the url and the project
id gathered from the given credentials return BadRequest and an error message
pointint out to a wrong url.

From now on this scenario will return Unauthorized (401), since you're possibly
trying to access something that your id doesn't allow, and a message saying:
"Project id from given credentials and url don't match".

Change-Id: Ib066394e5d2f5062b6160344d8c7764cffd7d16d
Fixes: bug #915151

commit_message:
Use WritableLogger from common code

There no need for wsgi.py to define a WritableLogger class, for we should use
it in the glance/openstack/common/log.py

Change-Id: I23d3f5db06e2a829c09930e6511497a3813127f5

"}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-05-07 02:17:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Here's the change in openstack/requirements which prevents this:

  commit c4177ff904ebe2701435ecff820c5ac5b0e7c506
  Author: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>
  Date:   Wed Apr 10 06:37:41 2013 +1000

      Add dnspython as a requirement.
    
      This is needed for the dynamic dns driver I have for nova. I've
      selected the version number based on what pip is currently
      installing, and therefore what I have tested.

I'm not sure we could get buy-in for rolling that version back; maybe it's better to just let packaging of all OpenStack Stuff need dnspython >= 1.10.0.

Individual packages are free to munge or even entirely remove the requirements.txt file should they want to package Swift against an older version of dnspython."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-05-09 02:22:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The requirements repo currently lists dnspython >= 1.10.0 as the version that is required by OpenStack. That's there because that's what I needed for nova when I was developing on Oneiric.

Can you provide a URL to changes between the two releases?

The right place to discuss this would the requirements repo though... OpenStack projects should line up with that."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-05-09 02:26:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry to rephrase. I am ok with this. Propose it for requirements and I will say so over there.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-09 20:32:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FWIW, the openstack/requirements change is at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/28653/ if anyone wants to go chime in there.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-17 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-06 22:12:49.000000000', 'message': "Bump dnspython requirement back

...to the version included with Ubuntu Oneiric and Precise LTS (1.9.4).
Pretty sure Swift doesn't need anything in dnspython introduced between
1.9.4 and 1.10.0, and it makes packaging easier if system packages can
satisfy the dependency.

Change-Id: I0c0f14896dc992156b4ea64546b5e4b667e7f113
"}]
commit_message:
Bump dnspython requirement back

...to the version included with Ubuntu Oneiric and Precise LTS (1.9.4).
Pretty sure Swift doesn't need anything in dnspython introduced between
1.9.4 and 1.10.0, and it makes packaging easier if system packages can
satisfy the dependency.

Change-Id: I0c0f14896dc992156b4ea64546b5e4b667e7f113

[{'created': '2013-04-29 23:06:24.000000000', 'message': "ec2 CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes status mapping

'attaching' and 'detaching' are not valid ec2 API volume status
values. Instead map them both to 'in-use'.

Note this will not pass the devstack exercises until
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27244/ goes through

Fixes bug #1074901

Change-Id: Id3dfd525d24d622aab5e350e42713fdb7671b31e
(cherry picked from commit fd6fa90d5f293be7fac4f1e612958cc8e55ee796)
"}]
commit_message:
ec2 CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes status mapping

'attaching' and 'detaching' are not valid ec2 API volume status
values. Instead map them both to 'in-use'.

Note this will not pass the devstack exercises until
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27244/ goes through

Fixes bug #1074901

Change-Id: Id3dfd525d24d622aab5e350e42713fdb7671b31e
(cherry picked from commit fd6fa90d5f293be7fac4f1e612958cc8e55ee796)

commit_message:
Progress reports via callbacks for get/put_object

With other cloud storage drivers, such as amazon s3 or google cs
apiclient it's possible to track upload/download progress and
execute code in the process.

Change-Id: Id8e4018a4785f376dca3c85b58cb5b190a488a92

Change-Id: Ic58ebf6348454271028de709a07b78b65b0d4973

commit_message:
Add a break point after the image is finished.

Add a debugging break point after all operations have completed, so the
final state of the image can be inspected/tweaked before it is
unmounted.

Change-Id: Ic58ebf6348454271028de709a07b78b65b0d4973

'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-03-27 10:58:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

(3 inline comments)

Hey,

I'd like to see  a blueprint for handling transport limits or at least it should be part of the transport-base blueprint. 

TBH, I think that a more simple approach in a case-per-case basis could be used instead of having a limit module inside common/

Also, notice that this kind of limits can vary between API versions so, most likely it should be implemented directly in the API version package (v1).

Thoughts? Suggestions? Ideas? :)

Cheers,
FF"}, {'account_id': 6943, 'date': '2013-03-27 13:38:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

We may need to namespace this file, like v1/limit.py'}, {'account_id': 6943, 'date': '2013-03-27 14:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-27 14:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Do not check "ttl", "body", or meta in mongodb.

And move the time fetching out of the loop.

Change-Id: I624478b8b4e6f9dd2dad94aa29e32fabcdff57b0

commit_message:
Moved some code out of swift.obj.replicator

This will be needed in future replication work to avoid circular
imports.

I used swift.obj.base as the module name just because we seemed to
avoid putting code in __init__.py files so far and I didn't want to
buck the trend.

I would love to see other obj things like *_metadata and DiskFile
move into swift.obj.base as well and swift.obj.server just be the
WSGI server logic, but I'll leave that for the future.

I have changed the tests as little as possible (just the references
to where they get the code to test) to show the refactor has not
broken anything. I did add a test for tpool_reraise since there was
none before.

There will be a follow on patch for moving the tests to their new
location(s). I figured I'd wait to put the bikes in the shed until
everyone's done painting it.

Change-Id: I32b4ac88be21eb76c877d3f4cc1e6ac33304835b

'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-04-30 18:14:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looks like the count headers are now missing for GET/HEAD of a not-yet-auto-created account.  That doesn't totally freak me out, but it's a change and is a perceptible difference between an account that's actually been auto-created and one which hasn't.

I have a mild preference for the "Fake-it" during HEAD/GET was imperceptibly realistic for clients.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-05-01 09:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-05-01 09:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Darrel

Thanks for noticing this. 
Fake it in autocreate was improved to align to the post autocreate GET. 
(Changed to 204 and added the necessary headers)

Please have another look'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-05-01 09:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-01 10:18:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27724/3/check/gate-swift-python27/2329 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27724/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/14126 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27724/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/20193 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/27724/3/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/1956 : FAILURE (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-05-01 15:39:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Less important, probably but still slight differences in returned headers.  Before actual account creation:

  HEAD
  Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8

  GET
  Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8

After a POST to actually auto-create the account:

  HEAD
  Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8

  GET
  Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8

So I guess it's the normal HEAD response that's the odd man out..."}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-05-01 20:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-05-01 20:42:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Done - Aligned all with text and charset utf-8 which seem most aligned with the standard'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-01 21:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27724/4/check/gate-swift-pep8/2255 : SUCCESS in 00:00:21
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/27724/4/check/gate-swift-docs/2083/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 00:01:05

'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-05-03 10:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I have tested every possible combination I could think of this and this behave like before, albeit like you say less messy.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-03 17:56:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Either there's some weird stuff going on here, or I need way more coffee to comprehend this diff. Confusion inline."}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-05-04 19:13:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sam, 

We cant have it both ways. 

Either we want the fake response to align to the non fake response, or we don't. 

This patch was not meant to change the interface that we have today. And the Fake it simply fake what is already sent by an empty account today. 
(Actually we did make a small change since GET responded differently from HEAD and at least to HEAD code made more sense). 

If want to also make changes in the responses that we are making when an empty account is encountered, lets do that in a separate patch. 

I suggest to therefore merge this unless someone is not ok with the changes made to GET vs. HEAD"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-04 19:56:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: No score

Oh, so Swift is already giving out stupid empty-account listing responses when the account really exists, so this is just making an identical response in the fake-it-out case?

Yeah, I see where you're coming from, and a separate patch to fix them is definitely the right way to go.

Thanks for clarifying."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-10 06:54:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(8 inline comments)

I think there's some inefficiency in the proxy in the account POST request.

The old behavior was (1) try a POST (2) if 404 and autocreate, do a PUT

The new behavior is (1) try a POST (2) if 404 and autocreate, (2a) do a PUT and ignore the return value, (2b) do a POST.

It seems to me like the PUT request in step 2a can do everything, and if account_autocreate() were able to take the X-Account-Meta headers from the request, then you'd be okay skipping the POST entirely. (Of course it'd have to be optional to take the request; in the container PUT handler, you have no request with X-Account-Meta headers in it.)

I can see it going either way, honestly. If you do the PUT-then-POST thing, then you can rely on always returning the same response as in the real account POST case. I think the account server gives you either a 201 or a 202 for a PUT, but a 204 for a POST, so you'd have to screw with the response code before sending it to the client. So, the question really is: would we rather have extra knowledge in the proxy server that an account POST returns 204, or would we rather have an extra request to the backends on account POST?

Right now I'm leaning slightly toward extra knowledge, but if you disagree, then I will probably be easily convinced to go with extra requests.

(Oh, and there's some typos and other baloney in the tests. If you submit a new patchset, it'd be nice to clean them up, but I won't hold up this review over just that stuff.)"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-15 21:22:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Alright, this seems sane.

I believe John Dickinson wanted a chance to take a look, though, so I'm going to hold off on the +1 Approved for a couple days until he either looks at it or forgets about it. :)"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-15 21:24:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Approved

commit_message:
Autocreate cleanups

Autocreate was messy - now cleaned.
Auto-create now occurs at account POST, and container PUT only.
A method for autocreation was added
Autocreation was removed from account_info and container_info.

Fake-it as if the account exists on account HEAD and account GET.

Return 404 on everything else when the account does not exist.

Fix: Bug #1172223
Fix: Bug #1179140
Change-Id: Iac54c1438eb09883fbc29a1ad2ac2245b95efc92

commit_message:
Add psutil

psutil is currently in heat-cfntools. Not having it in upstream
requirements means that we can't edit the heat-cfntools pip-requires.

Change-Id: Iecfa6ea0c4296873e8b6d72ee9d03c60b84925fc

commit_message:
Fix ./run_tests.sh --pep8

Create a common script to call flake8 to share flake8 options and
make tox and run_tests.sh use this script.

Fixes bug: 1179331

Change-Id: I92dc54fa3f4bb22aa39bde226b6d769088f9a2e3

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors and make it pass Jenkins tests.

Fix all existing pep8 errors.
Remove install_venv and friends, which were not needed.
Add a few ignores for nova code that is yet to be cleaned up.
Skip one failing test case, fixed by review 29394.
Import contrib/redhat-eventlet.patch from Nova.

Change-Id: I46b6ccaa272bd058757064672ce9221263ed7087

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-05-15 13:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Collections have next/previous pagination links that the client should follow, rather than trying to build paginated links itself.'}, {'account_id': 6610, 'date': '2013-05-16 01:34:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

V3 now just return collections with null previous/next links. IMO, client shoud give an argument per_page. maybe '-1' to return all collections. positive to return with right previous/next links."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-05-16 18:20:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

that's just awful; the design here is up to the server-side implementation and the client should be agnostic"}, {'account_id': 6610, 'date': '2013-05-17 01:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Changed cookbook name to openstack-compute

Changed the cookbook name to openstack-compute, fixed all tests, and
addressed attributes. Also addressed calls to external services,
primarily keystone -> openstack-identity.

All tests pass.

Change-Id: Ic567a33cefd78cc3b2217986d3ff7475bc93f874

commit_message:
Clean up import of cinderclient exceptions

Don't import a particular version of the cinderclient API - just import the
client module and pass the version we want to the Client() constructor as
is intended. This allows up to access the exceptions directly through
client.exceptions, rather than having to do a separate import.

Change-Id: Ic0e47506a51a572da01fdfdef0367cfdb3e34d54

commit_message:
Move Volume polling to check_create_complete()

Rather than poll in a loop inside handle_create(), use
check_create_complete() to check the status of the Volume.

Fixes bug #1178578

Change-Id: Icea7154c6e3763c977bd41671f51736c4a366141

commit_message:
Handle errors in Volume creation

Set the resource_id as soon as it is know, since we need to be able to
delete the volume later, even if it is in an error state. Avoid attempting
to perform a snapshot if the volume was never created successfully.

Change-Id: I33dd842d3d249bafe1037c1b97abf1979f605712
